info.title: Setster Scheduling API
info.description:
The Setster API is used to control your accountâ€™s data programmatically. The API is organized around REST  and standard HTTP verbs. A consistent envelope is used for all responses alongside response codes to indicate the status of the message and any error codes. JSON is returned on all our API responses with a consistent structure for all messages.

In order to use the Setster API you will need the API key that you can find within your Setster account and note you should never expose your  API key in any public website's client-side code. The Setster API works on HTTPS only.

# Authentication

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

post.description: The first step to using the Setster API is to authenticate to an account. Authenticate your account by including your key and email in an API request. In the returned response, the session_token should be used for all future API calls. Please note the session_token expires within 24 hours at which you need to re-authenticate and retrieve another session_token to keep the connection open.

401.description: Account is not active or Incorrect API key

get.description: Retrieves account details

post.description: Creates an account or child account

get.description: Retrieves child accounts of parent account.

post.description: Edits business details for an account.

get.description: Retrieves account booking options.

get.description: Retrieves personal details.

post.description: Adds or edits account logo.
Adds or edits splash image.

get.description: Retrieve account info.

html.example:
<!-- Begin Setster Widget -->
<script type="text/javascript"
charset="utf-8">
  var is_ssl = ("https:" == document.location.protocol);

  var setsHost = is_ssl ? "https://www.setster.com/widget/" :
  "https://www.setster.com/widget/";
  document.write(unescape("%3Cscript
  src='" + setsHost + "js/setster_over.js?v=2'
  type='text/javascript'%3E%3C/script%3E"));
</script>


  <script type="text/javascript" charset="utf-8">

  var setster_widget_options = {};

  setster_widget_options.display =
  "overlay";  
  setster_widget_options.uri = "boxadoro";

  setster_widget_options.placement = "right";  

  setster_widget_options.buttonName = "Appointment";  

  setster_widget_options.setsterURL = setsHost; 
   var setster_widget =
  new Setster.setster_widget(setster_widget_options);
</script>

  <!-- End Setster Widget -->
"

post.description: Initiates a password reset process. In order to reset the password a pre request must be made.

parameters.name: confirmation_url
parameters.description: The base url used to generate the confirmation link in the email message that is sent to the client. Confirmation link = confirmation_url + '?email={userEmail}&hash_code={hashCode}'

post.description: Modifies the account password using the valid hash_code that was used when initiating the password reset process.

get.description: Check nickname availability
Check email availability
Using this endpoint you can retrieve the attributes of all your locations

post.description: Using this endpoint you can create a new location within the account

put.description: Using this endpoint you can change the attributes of a location within the account

delete.description: Using this endpoint you can delete a location within the account

post.summary: Assign all services and employees to a location
post.description: Using this endpoint you can assign services and employees to a location

data.description:
The following format is used:
`{ PROVIDER_ID: [ SERVICE_1, SERVICE_2, ...]}`
To assign services to all providers at a location use:
`{0: [SERVICE_1, SERVICE_2, ...]}`

post.description: Using this endpoint you can add/update the location photo
Using this endpoint you can remove the location photo
Change the order in the list of locations

ord.description: The order number in the list

get.description: Retrieve the attributes of all your service providers

parameters.name: statuses
parameters.description: By default only active employees are returned. This filter allows to return all the employees, including the inactive ones

put.description: Using this endpoint you can change the attributes of a location within the account

delete.description: Using this endpoint you can delete a service provider within the account.

put.description: Using this endpoint you can change the availability of a service provider within the account.

post.summary: Assign all services and locations to an employee
post.description: Using this endpoint you can assign services and locations to an employee

data.description:
The following format is used:
`{ LOCATION_ID: [ SERVICE_1, SERVICE_2, ...]}`
To assign services to all locations for an employee:
`{0: [SERVICE_1, SERVICE_2, ...]}`

get.description: Using this endpoint you can synchronize a service provider with externals calendars.

parameters.name: export
parameters.description: If not present default action is the import

get.description: Retrieves availability for an employee / service provider.
Retrieves availability for an employee / service provider.
Retrieves availability for an employee / service provider.

post.description: Using this endpoint you can add/update the employee photo
Using this endpoint you can remove the employee photo
Change the order in the list of employees

ord.description: The order number in the list

get.description: Check nickname availability
Check nickname availability
Retrieve available time intervals

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: The ID of the selected service

parameters.name: subservices
parameters.description: The IDs of the selected subservices

parameters.name: location_id
parameters.description: The ID of the selected location

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: (YYYY-mm-dd) The day for which the availability is requested

parameters.name: t
parameters.description:
- If 'weekly', then the availability for the whole week of 'start_date' will be returned.
- If 'daily', only the availability for 'start_date' will be returned

parameters.name: return
parameters.description:
- If 'boxes', the availability will be returned as a set of boxes representing fractions of an hour.
- If 'times', the availability will be returned as times when the availability slots begin.

parameters.name: timezone_id
parameters.description: The ID of the timezone relative to which the availability is calculated. Defaults to the location timezone.

parameters.name: first_available
parameters.description: When there is no availability from start_date to the end of the interval(t - daily/weekly), whole agenda is scanned until a first available time slot is returned.

parameters.name: available_seats
parameters.description: Retrieve available seats for an appointment start time. This will return the number of seats for an employee. If none is provided, a random employee will be selected and the number of seats for that employee will be returned.

parameters.name: total_seats
parameters.description: Use this parameter to get the total number of seats for all employees

parameters.name: no_of_weeks
parameters.description: Used to retreive the availability for one month. Accepted values are between 1 and 5

post.description: Creates a new holiday.
Updates a holiday.

get.description: Returns the list of holidays ordered by start_date
Returns the holiday with specified ID.

post.description: Deletes the holidays with specified IDs.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description:
A list of holiday ids, separated by comma.
Example:
* 234,345
* 234

get.description: Using this endpoint you can retrieve the attributes of all your existing Setster appointments. We advise using filters to fetch appointments on specific date ranges or attributes. See Filtering appointments in the Introduction section.

parameters.name: timezone_id
parameters.description: Returns appointments date fields with specified time offset

parameters.name: updated_after
parameters.description: Lower date limit for which the appointment was updated

parameters.name: updated_before
parameters.description: Upper date limit for which the appointment was updated

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: Lower date limit for which the appointment was created

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: Upper date limit for which the appointment was created

parameters.name: num_results
parameters.description: If 1, the call returns only the number of appointments found

post.description: Using this endpoint you can create a new appointment within the account. You will have to specify the service and the service provider you are creating the appointment for, along with all the other appointment attributes. This will initiate the scheduling process within Setster.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl -i -X POST \
'https://www.setster.com/api/v2/appointment?session_token=YOUR_API_KEY_HERE' \
-H 'Content-Type: application/json' \
-d '{
  "data": {
    "company_id": 3123,
    "client_email": "user@example.com",
    "client_name": "Test Client",
    "client_phone": "12345678",
    "client_address": "string",
    "employee_id": 12412,
    "location_id": 54232,
    "service_id": 453,
    "start_date": "2019-09-01 12:00",
    "duration": 15,
    "note": "string",
    "status": 0,
    "subservices": "string",
    "paid": false,
    "price": 0,
    "ews_id": "",
    "custom_fields": {
      "1": [
        "(01512) 793246",
        "Work Phone"
      ],
      "2": [
        [
          "201 S. Division St.",
          "500",
          "Ann Arbor",
          "MI",
          "48104"
        ],
        "Full Address"
      ],
      "3": [
        "123ABC",
        "Coupon Code",
        "h"
      ]
    },
    "timezone_id": 553
  }
}'"

session_token.name: session_token
session_token.description:
To get the session_token, first you need to make a POST
request to "account/authenticate" using your API key or
username and password. The session token is the element
"data.session_token" from the response.

map_url.description: An http address used for locations display

account_type.description: Account bussiness profile: 0 - Free User, 1 - Personal, 2 - Small Business, 4 - Medium Business, 5 - Large Business, 6 - Team

enable_locations.description: Allow other location than the implicit one

max_providers.description: The maximum number of locations and providers that the company is allowed to add

nick_name.description: Unique string Ex: nick_name.setster.com. May contain only letters and digits

email.description: Contact of the main and default employee. Together with the password is used as user name

password.description: Used along with the account email

first_name.description: Personal info for the main/default employee

last_name.description: Personal info for the main/default employee

company_id.description: The ID of the company that owns the location. Field is writable when entity is owned by child accounts.

is_main.description: Whether this is the main location for the company (the location created on registration)

paypal_email.description: The PayPal account used for payments for the appointments that are booked on this location. If empty, the company account will be used.

timezone_id.description: The ID of the time zone

lat.description: The latitude of the location automatically calculated based on its address

lng.description: The longitude of the location automatically calculated based on its address

update_lat_lng.description: Available only on update. If true (1) then the lat and lng values will be automatically calculated

links.description:
Links with employees and services.

If *links: \"all\"*, all providers and services will be linked to this location.

If *links: {EMPLOYEE_ID: \"all\"}*,  all services will be linked to this location for the provider with EMPLOYEE_ID id.

If *links: {\"all\": {SERVICE_ID_1: 1, SERVICE_ID_2: 1, ... }}*, the services with id's SERVICE_ID_1, SERVICE_ID_2, ... will be linked to this location for all the providers

If *links: {\"EMPLOYEE_ID_1\": { SERVICE_ID_1: 1, SERVICE_ID_2: 1, ... }, \"EMPLOYEE_ID_2\": { SERVICE_ID_3: 1, SERVICE_ID_4: 1, ... }, ... }*,  the specified services will be linked with the specified providers

company_id.description: The ID of the company of the employee. Field is writable when entity is owned by child account.

email.description: Unique Email address of the employee

public_email.description: Whether or not the employee's email will be displayed on the widget

username.description: Automatically generated based on the first and last names

nickname.description: Unique nickname per company. May contain only letters, digits, the dot character and the underline character.

receivesms.description: If true (1) then the employee will receive an SMS message informing them about new appointments

sms_email.description: The SMS service to be used in the following format: number@sms-service.com. Note: the number keyword will be replaced with the employee's phone number before the SMS is sent.

is_owner.description: Whether the employee is the owner of the company (the employee created at signup). By updating the value for a created employee, areas from permissions can be managed for (all - 1/own - 0) account(s)

ics_service.description: Import calendar source type. Possible values: 0 - Not set 1 - Google 2 - Outlook or other public URL calendar source (ics) 3 - Exchange

ics_export_service.description: Export calendar source type. Possible values: 0 - Not set 1 - Outlook 2 - Ical 3 - Google 4 - Yahoo 5 - MSN 6 - ICalDav

ics_url.description: iCalendar public url used as import source.

ics_export_url.description: iCalendar public url used as export source.

permissions.description: Lable(s) for different application sections. In order to set permission an employee must have a user(can_login - 1). Possible values: locations, providers, services, availability, appointments, get_widget, promote, clients, overview, calendar, settings, profile, account

can_login.description: Whether the employee can login to his account or not. An employee that cannot login will not have access to the API.

send_invite_email.description: Available only when creating a new employee - will send an email to the email address of the newly created employee

company_id.description: The ID of the company that the service belongs to. Field is writable when entity is owned by child account

duration.description: The duration of the service in minutes

description.example: This service should be used in testing only

auto_confirm.description: If true (1) then the appointments made for the service will be automatically confirmed. If false (0) then the appointments must be confirmed by the provider.

is_subservice.description: If true (1) the service will be an additional service, otherwise it will be a base service.

duration_padding.description: The minimum number of minutes between two adjacent appointments

prior_notice.description: The minimum number of hours the appointment has to be scheduled before the scheduled time

after_notice.description: The maximum number of days the appointment has to be scheduled after the scheduled time

cancel_appointment.description: The minimum number of hours before the appointment until the client can cancel the appointment. If 0 the client cannot cancel the appointment.

reschedule_appointment.description: The minimum number of hours before the appointment until the client can reschedule the appointment. If 0, the client cannot reschedule.

send_reminder.description: The minimum number of hours before the appointment until the client can reschedule the appointment. If 0, the client cannot reschedule.

start_step.description:
Number of minutes.
If this field has a value different than 0, then the clients can choose any start time (in increments equal to the value of the field) for their appointment in the availability zone.
If the value of the field is 0, then the clients can select only predefined time slots for the appointments.

set_schedule.description: If `true` the service can only be performed on the schedule times. If `true`, availability can be added to the service through the `schedule` field

schedule.description: The service can only be performed on the following times. The `set_schedule` needs to be set to `true` for this field to be considered.

payment_min_amount.description: The minimum amount required for the payment to be valid

allow_cash_payment.description: Whether or not to allow the client to skip the online payment and pay with cash

group_session.description: The number of appointments that can be scheduled in the same time slot.

client_instructions.description: The message sent to the client in the confirmation email (after the client verifies his/her email address)

widget_message.description: The message displayed on the widget after the client books an appointments

ord.description: The order number of the service

created_at.description: The time when the service was created

active_from.description:
The date when the service starts to show up on the widget. If this field is null, then there will be no limit on the start date.

To set the field to null, set it to the empty string when updating the service.

active_until.description:
The date when the service stops being displayed on the widget. If this field is null, then there will be no limit on the end date.

To set the field to null, set it to the empty string when updating the service.

status.description: If 0 the service will not appear on the widget.

start_date.description: a date string with the format `day/month/year`

start_time.description: the start hour in the day

end_date.description: a date string with the format `day/month/year`. Used only if `repeat = 1` or `repeat = 2`

end_time.description: the end hour in the day

days.description:
A list of day numbers for the days when the service is available, of the form: `{"index1": 1,"index2": 1,...}`.
Ignored when repeat = 0. If `repeat = 1`, `index1, index2,...` represents the day number in the week.
If `repeat = 2`, it represents the day number in the month.

client_id.description: The ID of the client that made the appointment

company_id.description: The ID of the company that the appointment belongs to. Field is writable when entity is owned by child account

client_email.description: The email of the client that made the appointment

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee (provider) that the appointment is made for

location_id.description: The ID of the location where the appointment will take place at

service_id.description: The ID of the service that the appointment is made for

start_date.description:
The date and time when the appointment is scheduled to start.
The time is local to the company timezone or the location timezone (if the location is in a different timezone).
The format of the date is `yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss`

end_date.description:
The date and time when the appointment is scheduled to end.
The time is local to the company timezone or the location timezone (if the location is in a different timezone).
The format of the date is `yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss`

length.description: The duration of the appointment (in milliseconds). Example: 30 minutes = 1800000 milliseconds.

duration.description: The duration of the appointment in minutes

duration_padding.description: The appointment time padding (in seconds) - the number of seconds, before and after an appointment, that cannon be used for another appointment

status.description:
Appointment status. Possible values:

  - 0 - waiting email confirmation from the client
  - 1 - email confirmed but not validated by the admin/provider
  - 2 - email confirmed and validated or paid
  - 3 - declined or canceled
  - 4 - busy time imported from external sources (e.g. google)
  - 6 - busy time imported from Zapier
  - 8 - completed
  - 9 - no show (the scheduled event did not take place)
  - 10 - in progress
  - 11 - checked in
  - 12 - just arrived
  - 13 - delayed

type.description: The name of the service with ID service_id

last_updated.description: The date and time when the latest change was made to the appointment

subservices.description: IDs of sub services that were selected for the appointment separated by comma

paid.description: Whether the appointment has been paid or not, if the service requires a payment.

custom_fields.description:
The values of the custom fields filled by the client. The field can be updated only with a reschedule action.

Format: {"FIELD_INDEX":["VALUE","LABEL","TYPE"], ...}, with TYPE being set only for hidden fields when it takes the value "h"

- `FIELD_INDEX`:  the custom field index as defined by the user.
- `VALUE`:  the value filled in by the client. If the custom field type is Address, then this field will be a JSON array with 5 elements: address, apt, city, state/province and zip, in this order
- `LABEL`:  the label of the custom field
- `TYPE`:  has a single possible value - "h" - and is present only for hidden fields

timezone_short.description: The time zone short name (e.g. PST or GMT+4)

timezone_offset_seconds.description: The time zone offset in seconds

timezone_id.description: The ID of the time zone in our database

id.description: Unique ID of the custom field

company_id.description: The ID of the company that the custom field belongs to

label.description: The label of the custom field

length.description: The max string length of the custom field

type.description:
Type of the custom field. Possible values:

- 0 - text
- 1 - multiline
- 2 - phone
- 3 - email
- 4 - hidden
- 5 - address
- 6 - title

required.description: If the custom field is mandatory in the booking form

visibility.description:
Places where the custom field is visible. Possible values:
  - 1 - Appointment submit form
  - 2 - Contact form
  - 3 - Both forms

readonly.description: The readonly property of the custom field form.

hint.description: The hint property of the custom field form

company_id.description: The ID of the company that the client belongs to

employee_id.description: The ID of the employee that the client is associated with

name.description: The full name of the client

last_app_date.description: The date and time of the last appointment made by the client

date_created.description: The date and time when the record was created.

birthday.description: Only the day and month are relevant

cient_since.description: The date the client first scheduled an appointment or was created. This field is editable.

accept_emails.description: Whether or not the client accepts email marketing

photo.description:
The base name of the photo file. If not null or empty, it can be used to get the client photo:
- `small`:  65x65 (cropped to aspect ratio)  https://www.setster.com/admin/images/clients/s_[photo]
- `medium`:  100x100 (cropped to aspect ratio)  https://www.setster.com/admin/images/clients/m_[photo]
- `large`:  300x300 (not cropped)  https://www.setster.com/admin/images/clients/l_[photo]

type.description:
The type of the holiday:
* `1` - holidays that have variable dates. Example: Thanksgiving, which is celebrated in U.S. on the fourth Thursday in November
* `2` - holidays with fixed dates. Example: Christmas

start_date.description: The date and time when the holiday starts. It can be used in the request for creating or updating holidays only for holidays with `type = 2`. For holidays with `type = 1`, the start date is calculated based on the values of `day_in_week`, `month` and `day_order`

end_date.description: The date and time when the holiday ends. It can be used in the request for creating or updating holidays only for holidays with `type = 2`. For holidays with `type = 1`, the start date is calculated based on the values of `day_in_week`, `month` and `day_order`

day_in_week.description:
The number of weekday. Only for holidays with `type = 1`.
* `0` - Monday
* `1` - Tuesday
* ...
* `6` - Sunday

month.description:
The number of weekday. Only for holidays with `type = 1`
* `0` - January
* `1` - February
* ...
* `11` - December

day_order.description:
The order number of the weekday selected by `week_in_day` in the month selected by `month`. Only for holidays with `type = 1`
* `0` - First
* `1` - Second
* `2` - Third
* `3` - Fourth
* `4` - Last

year.description: The current year. Only for holidays with `type = 1`

timestamp.description: The timestamp of the holiday's start date in the current year

interval.description: The length (in minutes) of the appointment

boxInterval.description: Relevant only if return=boxes and represents the number of minutes in one box

padding.description: Relevant only if return=boxes and represents the number of minutes between two adjacent appointments

times.description: Hash table of the start times of the available appointment slots, grouped by date

events.description:
The list of events. The currently supported events are:

  1. `appointment.created`
  2. `appointment.updated`
  3. `appointment.deleted`
  4. `appointment.rescheduled`
  5. `appointment.reminder`
  6. `appointment.canceled`
  7. `*`

  The "`*`" event means that you will subscribe to all currently supported
  events as well as future added events.

id.description: Unique ID of the webHook subscriber
Unique ID of the webHook event

key.title: Key
key.description: The key used to store the selected value from this step

nextStep.title: Next step
nextStep.description: The next step the widget will go to after the user finishes with the current step

canSkip.title: Can skip step
canSkip.description: Option to set this step as being skippable or not. If you set this to true, you need to have the nextStep property defined in the step and not in the tile

label.title: Step value label
label.description: The label used to show the value selected in the step. This will be used in the summary screen

tiles.title: Tiles
tiles.description: Here you can define the different tiles of the step

tileTitle.title: Tile title
tileTitle.description: Here you can set the tile title

tileDescription.title: Tile description
tileDescription.description: Here you can set the tile description
tileDescription.example: The description of the first tile

img.title: Tile image
img.description: A link to a image that will be displayed for the tile

value.title: Tile value
value.description: This is the value we will store and send along with the appointment when the user selects this particular tile

nextStep.title: Tile next step
nextStep.description: The next the widget will go to if the user selects this tile
